result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:49 PM Defendant Shawn M Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Shawn M Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Case is dismissed and read in to 22CF671 and 22CM657.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:56 AM Defendant Shawn M Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Shawn M Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense would like time to look into alcohol treatment court.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:22 AM Defendant Shawn M Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Shawn M Garcia. Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

1:47 PM Defendant Shawn M Garcia in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
